methods.name: add_auth_source
methods.doc: Add a new authentication source in the system.. If the authentication source is of type LDAP or AD and if ssl is enabled, the response object will contain a list of certificates found matching with the provided host.if the authentication source is not of type LDAP or AD (or) if ssl is not enabled, then the authentication source is available for use as soon as the api call is successful.It is the duty of the caller to call the PATCH (/sources) api with the certificate details. Once the PATCH api call is successful, the authentication source is available for use.

methods.name: update_auth_source
methods.doc: updates an authentication source in the system. if the host is an ldap host and if host/port is changed, then the response will contain a list of certificates found matching with the host. It is the duty of the caller to call the PATCH (/sources) api with the certificate details. Once the PATCH api call is successful, the authentication source is available for use.

methods.name: get_auth_sources
methods.doc: Lists all the available auth sources in the system.

methods.name: patch_auth_source_with_certificate_details
methods.doc: Patch an already added authentication source with the certificate data.

methods.name: search_user_groups_for_auth_source
methods.doc: search user-groups for an auth source.  auth source can be SSO/LDAP/AD.

methods.name: import_users
methods.doc: import users from auth source. Auth source can be SSO/LDAP/AD.

methods.name: search_users_for_auth_source
methods.doc: search users for an auth source. auth source can be SSO/LDAP/AD.

methods.name: get_auth_source
methods.doc: Retrieve information about a particular authentication source.

methods.name: delete_auth_source
methods.doc: delete an authentication source. when deleting an SSO auth source, the 'user-name' and 'password' used during creation of the sso auth source should be sent in the payload object.

methods.name: get_auth_source_types
methods.doc: Lists all the available authentication source types..

methods.name: get_auth_source_type
methods.doc: Retrieve information about a particular authentication source type..

methods.name: acquire_token
methods.doc:
Acquire a token to perform REST API calls.. Performing a POST /api/auth/token/acquire would yield a response object that includes token and its validity.
HTTP Status 401 will be sent back if the authentication operation has failed.
NOTE: The validity of the acquired token is extended after each call and is set to 6 hours from the last call.

methods.name: release_token
methods.doc: Call this URL to terminate the current sessionId.

methods.name: assign_traversal_spec_to_user_group
methods.doc:
(Deprecated) Assign a traversal specification to a particular user.. Traversal specifications assigned through this API will add the specified traversal specification to a role permission for the ReadOnly role. It will also update the user's existing role permissions with this traversal specification.

This API is replaced by the assignRolePermissionToUser and unassignRolePermissionFromUser APIs which are PUT and DELETE operations respectively at the /auth/usergroups/{groupId}/permissions endpoint.
Note: mixing current and deprecated APIs is not recommended and may result in undefined behavior.

template_params.name: groupId
template_params.doc: Identifier of the user group to which the role permission needs to be assigned

query_params.name: name
query_params.doc: Array of resource names to query for. NOTE: Currently, only single element supported

query_params.name: regex
query_params.doc: Array of resource names in java regex format. NOTE: regex and name are mutually exclusive. If both are specified, name is given preference.

query_params.name: adapterKind
query_params.doc: Array of Adapter Kind keys

query_params.name: resourceKind
query_params.doc: Array of Resource Kind keys

query_params.name: collectorName
query_params.doc: Array of Collector names

query_params.doc: Array of Collector Identifiers

query_params.name: maintenanceScheduleId
query_params.doc:
Array of that identify Maintenance Schedules.
Since vROps 6.1.0 release onwards, we don't support search and look up of Resources using Maintenance Schedules' identifiers.

query_params.name: adapterInstanceId
query_params.doc: Array of  that identify Adapter Instances

query_params.name: recentlyAdded
query_params.doc: Return resources created after the specified value.  Value is the number of seconds since Midnight January 1, 1970 GMT.

query_params.name: resourceState
query_params.doc: Array of

query_params.name: resourceStatus
query_params.doc: Array of

query_params.name: resourceHealth
query_params.doc: Array of

query_params.name: parentId

query_params.name: credentialId
query_params.doc: Array of  that identify Credentials

query_params.name: resourceId
query_params.doc: Resource identifiers.

query_params.name: propertyName
query_params.doc: Name of property.  Query only supports filtering for a single property.

query_params.name: propertyValue
query_params.doc: Value of property named by . Omitting the will check for existence of the on the resource. NOTE: Use 'propertyConditions' to specify lookup of Resource using multiple properties.

query_params.name: statKey
query_params.doc:
Name of resource StatKey to validate value is within a range.
Use with , and to create comparison conditions NOTE: Use 'statConditions' to specify lookup of Resource using multiple stat keys.

query_params.name: statKeyLowerBound
query_params.doc: StatKey value matching range lower bound

query_params.name: statKeyUpperBound
query_params.doc: StatKey value matching range upper bound

query_params.name: statKeyInclusive
query_params.doc: Filtering by statKey values is inclusive or exclusive of boundary values.  Defaults to true

query_params.name: includeRelated
query_params.doc:
None null value specifies to include related resource ids of given relationship type in resource result. Uses the RelationshipType.representation value.
Allowed values are: PARENT, CHILD.

methods.name: get_stats_of_resources
methods.doc: Gets stats for one or more Resources using the specific query spec.</br>

query_params.name: begin
query_params.doc:
The beginning date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Value measures the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC

NOTE: If not provided, 24 hour rearward of ending date is used

query_params.name: dt
query_params.doc:
Indicates that the requested stats are based on some dynamic threshold.
 <b>Defaults to false which indicates that stats are not based on dynamic
 threshold.

query_params.name: end
query_params.doc:
The ending date as a long value of the range of stats to return
Long value is number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC

NOTE: The ending date must not be less than the beginning date.
If not provided, current time as UTC milliseconds is used

query_params.name: intervalQuantifier
query_params.doc: Number for the interval type

query_params.name: intervalType
query_params.doc: Interval type requested by the user (e.g: Days, Weeks, Months etc.)

query_params.name: latestMaxSamples
query_params.doc:
the maximum number of samples to return when querying latest. When processing the get latest stats query if it is omitted a value of 1 is assumed.
A query for the latest samples is not compatible with specifying the RollUpType value.

query_params.name: metrics
query_params.doc: Indicates whether specified statKey-s of query should be forcibly treated as metrics

query_params.name: resourceId
query_params.doc: Array of Resource ids to fetch the stats for

query_params.name: rollUpType
query_params.doc: Rollup Type requested by the user (e.g.: AVG, MIN, MAX etc.)

query_params.name: statKey
query_params.doc: Array of stat keys to return the stats for
